If 10. Kxh2 then 10. .... Ng4  and Black wins the knight by discovered attack.  This allows White to continue to threaten e6 and material gain, but Black is too quick for him.

Nh3 buys time for Black, but the weakness of the pawn at e3 means that White's position will simply decay until the end.  Other moves are bkunders; Kasparov also notes "[n]ot 14.Kxg1? Qh2#, or 14.Rxg1? Qh2  and 15...Qf2#"
